text:
I really wish I could give this place a better review. I've been three times and each time I've really enjoyed the food. The service, on the other hand, is just awful. Last Sunday my husband and I came for brunch. We were seated right away but sat there for 20 minutes before we even were offered water.  We finished our coffee before the food arrived and were never checked on to see if we wanted more. I actually had to go in the back with our mugs and ask for more coffee. They said they ran out and would bring us a carafe when it was ready.  Never did. 

Another time I was with four other girls for a happy hour/dinner. It was not busy at all and was fully staffed so I was thinking it would be a different experience. Unfortunately it just wasn't. From wanting more water/wanting to order another glass of wine, needing silverware & napkins with our food sitting there, and then trying to flag our server down to get our bill taken care of, it was just really disappointing. :( 

The good food just doesn't outweigh the poor service.

I held my wedding reception here for about 40 people and was given the run of the entire upstairs for the night.  We had a great time and the service was wonderful...we hit a few snags but were always able to work it out quickly and without any of my guests being any wiser :)  I would highly recommend this to anyone who is looking for a laid back but still classy place to have a private party and especially to the budget bride who doesn't want to pay thousands of dollars just to rent a reception venue.  They even recommended a cake maker who turned out to be an excellent choice, she did an amazing job on our cake and really contributed to some beautiful memories.

We had our own wait staff and bartender and all of my guests told me how much they enjoyed the intimate atmosphere...not really any room for dancing (although we did use the small area near the front as our private "first dance" area) but neither one of our families are the dancing type...although if they had been, there certainly would have been room if we had wanted it.  We used the private party menu which had some very good choices available and at reasonable prices too.

Overall the ambiance was intimate, the staff were very friendly and attentive, and we had a great time, as did all of our guests...and the best part is that I was able to arrange all of this by email as I live in Portland, OR!  Caitlyn and Sam were both very helpful and gave me some great advice on how best to use my limited budget and it turned out beautifully.
Very good food and nice ambience. I recommend the scotch eggs. So good! Great location too.

Brocach is one of the best bars to go to in Madison as far as being able to have a conversation and drink good drinks while still having a fun atmosphere. I like to drink upstairs where I can have a view of the capitol.  I used to love the lounge fries, but the last two times I have ordered them, they have skimped on toppings and looked like they've been sitting under the heat lamp for a long time. I hope these improve again. 
They always have vegan food, which is great. Also, try the Hibernian Berry for an after-dinner drink.
Irksome gimmicky pub atmosphere, like a classier Bennigan's.

Okay, we went to the square for dinner. Headed to Old Fashioned, but there was a 45 minute wait--which isn't uncommon, but we were hungry, so we left. We considered Red Sushi, which is great, but decided to try Brocach instead. It was cold out, and hot fare (like Irish stew, Shepherd's Pie, etc.) sounded good. 

It was not good. 

Not at all. 

To be fair, the bartender was nice, courteous, and attentive. 

We got the Corned Beef with Mash and Cabbage, and the Pork Belly Sandwich (side of Lobster Bisk). 

This was, without question, the worst food I've had in Madison. The Corned Beef smelled, and tasted, a bit like marijuana, making me wonder what they're doing back in the kitchen. The mashed potatoes had no flavor whatsoever, and neither did the cabbage. How do you F-up mashed potatoes? Just add butter and cream? Not only was it bland, but the portions were small. This was actually a blessing, because I didn't want to finish the food in front of me. The Pork Belly Sandwich had some odd cream sauce that would've hidden the fact that the pork belly had no flavor. Except that the sauce had no flavor. 

No joke: The highlight of the meal was the side of pickles that came with the sandwich. 

Extremely disappointing. I even ordered a Black & Tan, but they were out of English-style ale. 

If you want a pint and to socialize, this place is fine. For food, this was nothing short of a disappointment.

On a quiet Saturday for lunch, the staff was quick and attentive. Got the Veggie Shepard's Pie and the smoked salmon hash. Both good, especially the Veggie Shepard with an excellent mushroom gravy. Try the ginger black tea as a treat on a cold day!

i'm mostly judging brocach on its ambience since i've only eaten there once and hardly touched my meal (just wasn't too hungry that night). but this is definitely a place i love to come and meet up with friends. the booths are upstairs are big enough to sit 8, and when the rest of the group joins, there's plenty of room to grab a bigger table or just stand up and mingle. 

i love the dark wood, the noise level (loud from voices, but the music is at the right volume), the beers. definitely my idea of a good bar.

I've been to the Capitol Square Brocach a few times and have always enjoyed it.  But the Monroe Street Brocach has been a disappointment.  I'll never go back.

On my first visit I ordered the Vegetarian Shepard's Pie.  It was my favorite dish at the Capitol location -- always excellent!  Imagine my surprise when I was served a plate with a large pile of mashed potatoes on one side and an equally large pile of carrots and peas on the other side!  They were prepared nicely and were as tasty as mashed potatoes and carrots can be.   But it's cruel to trick a customer into thinking they're ordering a meal and then just slapping a couple of side dishes onto a plate.  Although I was disappointed, I was willing to give them the benefit of the doubt and assume that my next experience would be better.  Wrong!!!!

My second and final visit to the Monroe Street Brocach was yesterday.  It was St. Patrick's Day and my wife and I found the place comfortably full with the usual noise and din you'd expect from a crowd of people eating and drinking.  I like crowds so I felt comfortable with the situation.  We sat at the bar and ordered two pints of Guinness while waiting for a table.  With my first sip I was greeted by conflicting sensations.  First, the Guinness was cool, creamy and clean -- exactly how it should be.  But at the same time I noticed a new sound:  a blaring noise that became louder and louder until it reached a steady volume that drowned out conversation and completely dominated the atmosphere. After a moment I realized it was the TV.  Somebody had decided to blast a basketball game at maximum volume during dinner!

I looked around at the full restaurant and bar to see how other people were reacting.  Not a single face was turned to the TV screens.  It seemed like none of the patrons were interested in the game.  I left the bar and strolled through part of the dining area and found the noise to be almost as bad.  I realized that my hopes of a comfortable meal at Brocach were no longer realistic.  

But I had a nice pint of Guinness that needed my attention, so I figured I could distract myself with that.  After a couple of  minutes I couldn't take it any longer.  I politely asked the bartender if he would consider turning down the volume.  He looked at me sternly and said no.  I asked if he thought other people in the restaurant wanted to have the sound turned up so loud and he replied "yes".

I then did something I've never done before.  I walked away from a full glass of very tasty beer that I had just purchased.  I love beer and I hate wasting money, so it was hard to do.  But I just couldn't take the pointlessly obnoxious atmosphere that Brocach had created.  If I was in a sports bar I wouldn't have been upset.  It's to be expected, although the TV volume at Brocach was louder than most sports bars I've been in.

The Monroe Street Brocach has let me down twice.  I won't make the mistake of going there again.

Usually the folks are nice, usually the food's OK. Fine place to stop in for a beer. The fish fry I'm sure is good much of the time, but mine was way overcooked. The server recommended extra sauce for it, so I got it, then it turned out they charge extra for a ramekin full, just didn't say so beforehand. Wasn't thrilled about that.
No better spot for slug of Tully's and a scotch egg.

I went here with a large group of my family (a party of 8), and was pleasantly surprised when they were able to immediately accommodate us at 8pm on a Friday night with no reservation. The d√©cor isn't that great, but I am willing to overlook it because of the fact that we had couches to sit on at our table and the food was, with a few exceptions, pretty good.
 
With a party the size of ours, we tried a fair amount of the items on the menu. Their loaded fries, or whatever they call them, are awesome! They were immediately demolished by our table. The beer cheese was also delicious, and the steaks we had were perfectly cooked. My two complaints about the food were 1. Their fried fish was bland (my party concurred) 2. Tooooo much pepper in some dishes. Their potato leek soup tasted like the cap fell off the pepper while the spice was being added and they just went with it. It was just too much. This was echoed in the lemon-pepper fettuccine alfredo, but was still a pretty solid dish even with the peppery burn to every bite.

We frequent Brocach on Monroe St. often. Some of our favorite aspects of it are its ample seating and tasty food. The children's menu is fantastic, too--with the Maxburger being their favorite entree.

This past March, on my our very first trip to Madison, (from Chicago) my partner and I decided on food and a Pint at Brocach's.  Even though it was a little chilly that day, we had a couple pups with us and decided to brave the elements and sit outside.  The vegetarian Sheppard's pie was amazing as well as the Guinness, but that is not the only reason we fell in love with this place.  A homeless man, who appeared to be under the influence or living with mental illness, decided to claim a table at the outside seating area and disrupt other customers.  The manager, (do not know her name but she appeared to be in her late 20's with blond hair, came to diffuse the situation.  I have never seen such warm and beautiful treatment of another human being by restaurant staff.  I'm sure it happens, but I think our first instinct is to yell and scream and call the police.  This manager asked the man to leave, allowing him autonomy to do so.  On the third attempt she helped him over to the bus stop, entertaining his ramblings and protecting him from the hard concrete that he was destined to fall to!  When she returned, I praised her actions and she said it was nothing as she retrieved a glass of water for this gentleman to rehydrate with.  While trying to run an establishment, this amazing woman took the time out to help a fellow human being, and treat him with the respect that I am sure not many give him.  So to you blond manager, thank you for being a wonderful human being!!  Everyone should visit Brocach's if in Madison not only for the warm service, but for the food too!!  For a couple vegetarians at an Irish pub, our meals and beers were amazing!
Vegetarian Sheppard's Pie and Guinness ftw:)

Very cozy, family-friendly atmosphere with great Irish/pub food.  

Took our daughters with us who are 5 and 8 and they loved it.  I had the Bangers and Mash and my wife had the Fish and Chips and both were delicious.  Generous portion sizes.  I only ate half of mine and took the rest home for lunch the next day.  

Both the kids had Mac and Cheese and it wasn't some Kraft and Mac N Cheese, but homemade.  Ice Cream is included in the kid's meals which was a hit.  

Service was prompt and friendly and the food came out fast.  Brocach on Monroe St has  a great atmosphere whether you have kids or not and we'll definitely be going back.

As a vegetarian, I used to love that Brocach had a decent selection of meatless options. Apparently after the remodel, that is not the case. The only menu items I had to chose from were a soup and some salads. While I was here on Saturday night with my boyfriend, I ordered the Power Bowl and he got a burger. We got cheese curds for an appetizer, which had too much breading and weren't anything special at all. When our food came, my boyfriend's fries were cold, and he said the burger was just okay. My dish was a bit of a disaster, though. It is described as baby kale, romaine, quinoa, sweet potato, red beets, red onion, and toasted almonds. I looked though my bowl and there was no quinoa in sight, nor did I see any almonds. Worse yet, I I saw maybe two leaves of kale.I ordered the power bowl specifically for the quinoa and kale so I wouldn't end up with just a salad, as I'm not the type of person to order a salad at a restaurant because it's not all that filling and just seems like a waste of money. Not only did I end up with a salad, but I ended up with cheap romaine lettuce and not even decent greens. I asked our waitress, and it was then that she informed me they were out of quinoa, rather than informing me when I ordered it, so I basically ended up with a dish not even close to what I ordered, considering 3 of the ingredients were missing. She did offer more sweet potato and beets, but that didn't much compensate at all. I assumed she would chop a few dollars off of our bill, but she still charged me full price for the dish that wasn't even the actual menu item I ordered. Definitely not a great experience.

Brocach has a lot to offer, with a menu and service that ends itself well to repeat visits. The fish fry  is excellent, with outstanding choices for lunch or, better, Sunday brunch. In addition, the nicely selected wines fit the menu nicely. Yet it's the details that matter. The breads are nice: the rye and sourdough are excellent choices. The winter squash salad is exceptional. Yet wait staff make a difference -- Michael and Rebekah represent Brocach well. Kudos on having such a well run establishment.

I think Brocach is a solid option in Madison.  The menu is pretty diverse and the food is quite good for a pub.  Price are decent, maybe a little high.  I would say dinner entrees range from about $9-17 or so.  They have more traditional Irish options, like sheppard's pie or bangers and mash, as well as roast chicken, burgers, pasta and a few vegetarian choices.  As you would guess, they have a number of good beers, as well and wine and cocktails. Their brunch is actually good too.  I don't think that many people realize they serve it, because it's never that crowded.  

The place is large, so there usually isn't a terrible wait.  I don't remember every having a problem with service.  Atmosphere is nice.  They have typical Irish pub d√©cor, and the inside is well-maintained.

New to  Monroe Street this Irish Pub has the atmosphere of Ireland without all the smoke. Great service, food and from what it looked like from a teetotaler, a good supply of Guinness. 
The Fish & Chips, and the Mac & Cheese were hot & tasty.  We'll be back.

Great atmosphere, staff, and food! We ended up here when another restaurant close by said they couldn't (ever!) accommodate parties of more than 8, despite how many tables were available. Brocach was happy to accommodate us, the service was great, and the food was too. Highly recommend the apple old-fashioned.

I've done dinner and brunch here. The burger is ok - nothing to write home about. I enjoyed the brie mac & cheese, but that's a well you don't always want to drink from. The brunch options feel kind of limited and I was under whelmed.

 Decent selection of whiskey and sort of what you expect in Madison for beer. I like the atmosphere, the pseudo-pub-feeling-restaurant vibe is good.

I'll go again when the mood strikes, but it's not a must-visit destination for me.

Where did the Irish go!?

Those who remember the Brocach of years gone by might be a bit disappointed when they cross the threshold into the renovated tavern. The food is still good and the bar reflects the same broad variety of whiskeys and beer, but the new decor lacks the old homey feel. I'm missing the wobbly wooden tables and raucous groups hanging out upstairs. Three stars for good food and outstanding service, but bring back the Irish pub, please!

You really can't go wrong here. The brunch is amazing, and the rest of the menu is delicious. The atmosphere and waitstaff are wonderful too. It looks classy and has a neighborhood bar feel. Oh yeah, and beer, always good beer at decent prices.

Both my husband and I grew up in the restaurant industry. We are very critical of where and what we eat. This is my first, and will probably by my only, 5 star rating. 

We have been to Brocach many times. Each time we are impressed with the food and the service. We generally go to dinner on a Friday, Saturday, or Sunday evening around 7-8pm. We've always been greeted and seated right away. 

The salmon is unbelievably good. Most places dress salmon up with a sauce because it can be a fickle fish to prepare. it can be underdone, or overdone. The Broach's salmon was prepared perfectly! They are so confident in their ability to cook a good salmon, that it is served minus a sauce. Superb all around. 
My last meal was the Berkshire Porkchop. I took one bite and had a religious experience. Definitely recommended!

Besides the food, the service is great. Management has always been present and our servers have always been exceptionally knowledgeable and polite. In fact, our server last night, Zack, actually ASKED if he could take our plates when we  were finished. That is a level of politeness rarely found in these days of 'feed 'em and get 'em outta here' mentality. We never found ourselves waiting for a server, our food was served quickly, efficiently, and was excellent. The management and servers are warm and inviting. 

Because of the prices, this is often a once month or every other month splurge for us. But the cost is worth how delicious the food is!

Had some cocktails here during the winter festival. The atmosphere was great. We didn't eat so I can't comment on the food but the service was very good and we will be back. I'd recommend as a nice bar to gather at and I know they have live music as well.

Host seated us at our table and we were then ignored for 20 minutes, so we left. Several servers kept walking by us helping the tables around us, but we never received any acknowledgment. Ironically, the bartender did thank us as we were leaving. Will not be back.

Tonight was my second time to Brocach. The shepherd's pie my first time was amazing and filling. Tonight i went with the special, a pasta with chicken, asparagus, sauteed onions and parmesan/bread crumb crusting. Being primarily irish-oriented, this dish rivaled some of my best italian experiences! Bravo! I am very impressed and will be back. The bloody and blueberry press house cocktails are really good as well, as is the selection of whiskey.

We had a Saturday morning breakfast.  There were only three breakfast choices on Saturday and the lunch menu.  The options were corn beef and hash, french toast, and a vegetable frittata.  I was a a little disappointed by the lack of options.  My wife and I both ordered the frittata and we were not disappointed at all.  It was easily the best frittata that I have ever had.  It had cherry tomatoes, roasted peppers, mushrooms, asparagus, fresh basil, and ch√®vre.  It was absolutely delicious.  The fried potatoes that came with were cooked and seasoned perfectly.  We will definitely be back

I and 8 friends had dinner on yesterday. Foods were plain and dry but cheesecake was good. The main problem was a waiter. He showed up only 3 times: taking orders, serving and checking. He didn't take care us AT ALL. He didn't give us enough plates for appetizers and never gave me although I requested twice! In addition, I had to refill water by myself. 

OK food + TERRIBLE service = I'll NEVER go there again

This place is good if you only drink, not eat.

Went in on Sunday night for dinner. The place was relatively empty at first however as time progresses the place started to fill up. Out waiter was very nice and fast. Food was classically good and the restaurant itself was beautiful. The service was very fast and well planned. The bangers and mash was very delicious.

Brocach catered our Milwaukee wedding a few years ago and it was incredible food. Brocach has since moved out of the Milwaukee area, so for our anniversary this year we decided to head to Madison to enjoy Brocach again.
It was a Saturday around 11:30, and when we got there, there was only one other party in the restaurant. The server started off very attentive and helpful and took our order. 25-30 minutes went by and still no food. We don't mind waiting for food, even though we did feel that was excessive for how busy the restaurant was. But our server did not come and check on us one time, or give any update on our meal, or refill berverages. I had to walk over and ask the bartender for an update. Our food come out pretty much instantaneously after I asked. Our toddler's food seemed like it had been sitting under the heat lamp for a long, forgotten time. But my food, and my husbands food were so tasty. He had the irish breakfast and I had one of their specials. So, so good. It's a shame it was marred by such poor service. Don't know that we'll make the hour trek again unless we read that service has improved.

I received my food  more than 5 minutes after the rest of the party, and when I asked for a spoon to drink the broth it took until the broth was lukewarm at best. I'd recommend trying the other Brocach.

Worst Bar Bathroom in Madison

It's upstairs in a back hallway. Supposedly, the lesser known louvre. More like the louvre that not even the owner knows about because it's f-ing disgusting. There's one stall for an entire floor of intoxicated chicks. The door kind of closes, so you have to meet it just right with the door frame or it'll only close partway, making it look like nobody's in the stall. Not good on period nights.

The toilet isn't fastened to the floor, so it tips when you sit your drunk ass down. No idea why no one got around to bolting the toilet to the floor. Seems like a given, but, hey, this is the worst bar bathroom in Madison. Anything goes. Seriously, though, customers shouldn't be able to tip your toilet like a friggin' cow.
I had to try the Monroe St. Brocach after I read about the Circus of Chefs win. The food is absolutely incredible and unparalleled by any other restaurant in Madison. Can't wait to go back!

Never again. The place has a nice interior and is quiet but the service and the food are awful. I ordered the Irish Cheese Mac and a bottle of beer. The Mac were bland and cold by the time they arrived at our table and the beer came at room temperature. I was unable to ask for salt and pepper or even make a complaint because the waiter was a no-show for 45 minutes. Completely unacceptable. Will never go there again.
Really great food, decent beer selection, and great drinks. Try the Irish Coffee.

I don't know if I went on a bad morning or what, but my brunch was just barely edible.  It was served only lukewarm, the eggs were soggy (not exactly sure how to describe them?).  The whole thing was actually pretty forgettable except for my disappointment in the food and my annoyance with the slow and pretty dismissive waitress.  The place wasn't even full and she took forever to come around to us again. Also, I gues I would have thought most prices were overpriced for that food - but I really did not appreciate paying so much for soggy eggs I could have made better at home. Only the company (a good friend) saved the day! Not a fan.
Cead Mille Failte!  One thousand and one welcomes meet you here along with everything Irish.  Cozy warm place with good food and pints.  You will leave with an Irish brogue.

The food is expensive, but the happy hour will get you the best neat/rocks prices in the city on an extremely impressive array of whiskies. Bunnahabhain neat with a pint of Murphy's on the side, all for $10? They'll certainly be getting my business again!

This is a 5 star review for the fish fry, which was melt in your mouth delicious. Had to slooww it down on the walk home after eating because we were so full of fish, in the best possible way. Don't miss out on the marble rye bread! And curry cole slaw was a nice touch, too!
Atmoshere is Nice and does not feel as crowded as the one by capitol. My only disappointment was that the menu is different...but the food was very good.

We used to love eating here but unfortunately they changed the menu and it was a big let down tonight. Please bring back the old menu with the risotto salmon and duck-fat frites. Ambiance is still great though.

Outside seating was great. The staff switched halfway through our meal and the replacement dude was kind of not the best. But the food was great and the atmosphere is ten times better that the monroe st. location.

Who does not love a cool Irish Pub?  The decor on the inside is amazing and that is why it gets five stars.  The inside is much larger than it would appear from the outside and the food and beer is pretty good.

This place has really gone downhill. This used to be one of my favorite places in grad school. Unfortunately, both the food and the service have dropped off significantly. First, our group of 8 people were seated at a table that did not seat more than 6 comfortably. We had to ask to move. I asked for a beer, and it took forever to come out, probably 15-20 minutes. I got the fish and chips and asked for an extra tarter sauce, and by the time it came I had already finished the fish. Others at our table had a similar experience. The fish was mushy, and two of the pieces were battered together into one large piece with uncooked batter in the middle. The waitress then came back and brought the bill and asked if we were set without asking if we wanted dessert. Then a few minutes later she came back and said she really needed us to leave because they have a reservation, even though we hadn't even been there that long. The only reason I didn't give this one star is a couple people at the table thought their entrees were alright, but this sure isn't the place I remember. We won't be coming back.

I liked the old menu, but decided to try it after the remodel. I ordered mussels, which were probably the worst mussels I've had in madison. The broth didn't have a lot of flavor, except for salt! It was almost inedible it was so salty. And there was corn in it??? Not sure what two cuisines they were trying to "fuse" there, but it was not good. My friend ordered a salad, which she also found oddly salty? Why so, so much salt?

Was one of the worse dining experiences I have had in a long time.   Service was terrible took 2.5 hours to order and receive all of our food.   When it did come out it came out sporadically no one at our table could eat at the same time.   It also was so hot in the restaurant I was sweating during the meal.   This place is not worth your time or money.

Brocach - you made me sad tonight. I can see why there wasn't a wait for a table at 7pm on a Saturday (blessing and a curse?) Nice staff (server and hostess) nice comfy booth. But your food?! What happened? It used to be delicious - lick the sauce from the plate delicious. But now - you're serving frozen burger patties with wimpy thin-cut bacon? Not yummy. I'll remember your glory days pre-renovation.

I love this place so much that my fiance and I chose to have our rehearsal dinner upstairs in the lounge (reserved for no fee).  The atmosphere is so unique and cozy.  There's really no place like it in town.  The food NEVER disappoints.  Their chefs must really know what they're doing because their food is the kind that makes me say, "This is soo good," after every bite.  That's how you know I really love something.  

For brunch try the corned beef and hash--to die for!

Holy Fish Fry, Pacman!  A friend and I were in Madison for a concert a couple of weeks ago and were walking around the square trying to decide where to eat/drink.  We stumbled upon Broach and both had the all you can eat Fried Haddock.  It was very very good!!!  Nice flakey breading and the tender juicy meat inside cooked perfectly.  Being two hungry boys after the drive from Chicago, we must have eaten several pounds of fish.  The fries were crispy on the outside, soft on the inside, done right.

Atmosphere?  Easy to be in no bullshit Irish pub with good food.  

Were I living in Madison, I would try some different dishes as they have a good variety.  But if/when I'm ever back on a Friday, I'd probably opt for the Fish Fry again.

We went here for a post-graduation dinner and were very pleased.  There were 11 of us for dinner and they were ready and set up for us.  Good service as well.  I also liked the ambiance of the place -- kind of rustic.
Our food was good but forgettable.  Just a decent place with a nice atmosphere.
Went to this "irish pub" for irish breakfast.  Was informed they they "use to have irish breakfast, but no longer do."  This place an Irish pub as much as a processed cheese is a diary product.

Love this bar for drinks after work.  Great bar food and love the dim-lit atmosphere. 

 Took a star away because the last time I was there the service was very slow.  It was a badger game night and all, but when I have to be the one to initiate contact something is wrong.  The extra wait staff had no wait skills or personal skills whatsoever.  

In the end, i'm still going back again and again for their loaded fries!

visited this spot on the spur of the moment because it's directly across from the capital where they do the concert on the square with a colleague and her dad from out of town. i love irish pubs. my staple is to immediately go for the fish and chips. i seem to judge a pub on this dish, aside from any ales they make on tap (if it's a micro brew). but my eyes scanned the menu and i got caught up with some very uncharacteristic choices. 

we ordered the sweet chili shrimp for starters. very nice skewer of large shrimp and who can resist sriracha sauce? for an entree i ordered the lemon pepper fettuccine in an olive oil with mushrooms, leeks and parmesan. you have a choice of chicken, steak or salmon, but because i was such a fan of the shrimp, i asked my server if i could order it with shrimp instead. she told me they didn't serve shrimp... huh? 

i reminded her that i just had shrimp for the app, and she goes, "oh! no, those are PRAWNS." i couldn't help but laugh at this. nonetheless, i asked her to check with the kitchen to see if that would be possible. when she returned, she said they couldn't do it. funny. how hard is it to sautee a few shrimp and toss them on some pasta. right about now i'm regretting not getting the fish and chips. but i simply order another shrimp app with the meal and tell her i'll put the shrimp in the pasta my damn self. sheesh. 

food is good though. a little heavy handed with the oil, but the texture of the noodles was good, the flavor was pretty nice and light, and of course the shrimp set it off. place was noisy like a pub which i liked and expected, happy people having a good time.  good beer choices as well. i'll be back for the fish and chips.

Yes, the upscale Irish pub thing is overdone, but if it's done well, who cares. It's got a beautiful bar, large tap selection, and a great capitol view. I even love the fish fry. There are lots of nooks and crannies for you and friends to talk privately in a packed place.

After walking around Madison for a while, I decided to give this a try for dinner - and enjoyed it enough that I went back a second time a few days later.  Great beer, good service, and tasty food. Nice atmosphere, too.

There are lots of interesting restaurants in this area, and this is one of the tops.

Nothing to complain about at Brocach's 2 for 1 burger night! The special burger, called the Dublin City Burger was great. It had bacon, onion straws, mushrooms, and a guiness and cheddar sauce. So good! The service was also excellent and the food came out promptly, though it probably helped that they were dead tonight. The atmosphere was cozy and their playlist somehow included all my favorite songs, so that was a bonus.

I had been to Brocach a few times prior, but only for drinks. We chose Brocach to host a party for a group of about 15 people. Brocach accommodated all of our requests from beginning to end. Our waiter was excellent, friendly and there were no issues with service or food. All staff in the restaurant were helpful and kind. We were able to bring a cake and we were provided with a lot of space to eat, mingle, open gifts etc... It really could not have gone any better. Separate checks were also allowed which made it nice for our large group. 
Our event could not have gone any better and the restaurant truly made that possible.

Athe atmosphere is very homey. I felt like pounding steins on the tables like the hobbits in lord of the rings. Staff was great.

I had the braised lamb which I did not enjoy. It comes with a sweet grapes sauce and quinoa bed and kale salad. The sweetness was off putting. The salty savory flavors are far more migh style with meats.

Also got to try lobster bisque, the reuben (overly salty), the burger, pub fries, and curds. Everything was not bad but not great.

The food here is unpretentious though and seems to have soul behind it. I would not hesitate to visit again and would not be surprised if a different dish might push my opinion a little higher.
I had a good time here on St Patrick's Day. I recommend the fish n chips. I was hesitant because it was $14 but it was DELICIOUS!! Great service from Sam!

Fast and friendly service. Apparently there is a new chef. The Challah French toast was replaced by a banana French toast. 

Unfortunately, the dish was a huge miss. The toast itself was fine. The chef added a banana butter. He tried to be inventive and topped it off with an eclectic trail mix consisting of banana chips, cinnamon toast crunch cereal, and candied mixed nuts...It was far too much. The nuts made the entire dish too salty and threw the flavor. 

My recommendation to the chef: choose just one nut to candy, the pecan. The cashews and peanuts are far too much flavor and sodium. Then top with either fresh fruit, or perhaps a fancier bourbon banana. I ate half and felt wasteful because it wasn't even doggie bag worthy. 

I was a few blocks from my house before I threw up all $11 onto the sidewalk. 

I do like B in general, but this dish was such a catastrophe I am downgrading my previous '4' rating.
Recommend Shepherd's Pie, stew beef rather than steak

Tried Brocach for lunch and was pleasantly surprised! Our waiter was top-notch and my mixed greens salad with couscous and grilled salmon was delightful. What caught my eye as I was enjoying my lunch was all of the food being served to other tables. I am looking forward to going back and ordering something less healthy!

Food: delicious, stellar flavors,  perfect portions, speedy delivery to table. 
Wait staff: inattentive and juvenile
Customers: mixed group of arrogant hipster millennials and genuine good people who are just out to have a good time. 

Asked my waiter about a specific drink he didn't know. Had to ask him to ask the bartender if she was familiar with it. He came back and said I could go ask the bartender myself. . I can,  but why wouldn't I believe you when you said you asked? Ended up asking for what I thought was in the drink,  and the waiter snarkily asked whether it was what I was looking for.  Then ordered jameson, which my waiter referred to as "jamo" every time he mentioned it. 

Service was slow and disordered. We received our food before our drinks. Not sure if they were understaffed or just didn't care.

Had never been here before, the atmosphere is very comfortable and intimate. The waitresses were nice and somewhat attentive. My biggest complaint is the food. 
I was told the new chef recently change the ENTIRE menu and when we went they were still working out kinks in dishes they were serving to people. For the price the portions were small. Id understand the size if the food was amazing but they were still tweaking the menu. I think the chef may have just gotten out of culinary school or is feeling extra experimental. 
We got $12 duck wings which were ok but there were only a few on the plate and there was literal breakfast cereal on top which i think cheapened the dish. I ordered the venison dish which came out cold. The meat sat on a few random purees/reductions/sauces which i dont think paired well. I was also really confused about how i should go about eating it at first. My significant other got farro and it was actually pretty good however the tomatos were far too sour (i think they were pickled) and there was a lemon merangue(?) on top which tasted like lemon pledge, that was gross. 
I honestly just wanted traditional irish food so i was sort of disappointed. We spent $60 total. Maybe im just not enough of a foody to understand.

Went here today (Easter) with my family.  Was in the mood for warm comfort food so I ordered the shepherd's pie.  It wasn't bad but there was little flavor.  The pots and meat tasted the same.  Bummed.

My family went to Brocach on Sunday to celebrate our daughter's  finance's birthday.  We miss the half chicken with. Colcannon and saut√©ed spinach.  The food we had (fish' chips, bangers and mash, corned beef) was acceptable but not of the same caliber we had come to expect.
We don't go downtown a lot to eat. There are better places than this closer to our suburban life.

We visited Brocach's on Monroe Street on 4/9/14. Overall, the food was extremely disappointing. The service was adequate, but average.

We arrived and were promptly seated by a host who seemed a bit cranky. However, it was about 8pm on a Tuesday night, so the lack of waiting was not surprising. The restaurant does look very nice.  The decor is similar to their original Capitol Square location: dark wood paneling, cozy and warmly colored walls, and a very welcoming "Irish-Pub vibe".

We ordered the Beer Cheese Dip appetizer, which came with soft pretzel sticks for dipping. The dip arrived with a  congealed "skin" on top, as though it had been sitting out and cooling for awhile before being served. The liquid cheese underneath the solid surface had a bitter, almost metallic, aftertaste. I imagine that the goal was for the dip to have a pronounced beer flavor, but it didn't work for me. It hardly tasted cheesy at all, and the taste it left in my mouth was gross. My dining partner didn't seem to dislike this dish as much as me, so this could be a matter of my personal preference. However, for a $9 dollar appetizer, it should have at least been served piping hot, rather than lukewarm. Unfortunately, this item provided an ominous preview of what was still to come.

My partner was in the mood for something light so he ordered the American Club sandwich with french fries. He commented that the sandwich, which contained ham, turkey, cheddar, swiss, lettuce, tomato and mustard, was "extremely average", and rated it "5 out of 10". He liked his fries a lot though, and thought they were the saving grace of his meal. The fries looked and tasted a lot like McDonald's fries, and everyone knows how tasty those are!

In the mood to splurge with no regard to calories, I ordered off of the "Mac and Cheese" section of the menu. I got the Bacon Bleu Mac, which the menu claimed contained: "trottole pasta, bacon, scallions, cream, bleu cheese, cheddar cheese curds" 

What came out to me was: under cooked (hard and chewy) pasta in an extremely dry (nearly non-existent) generic cheese sauce.  The vast plate was topped with about 3 blue cheese crumbles, which was not enough to impart a discernible blue cheese flavor to the dish. There was an overwhelming amount of crumbled-up bacon and no scallions. 

The only flavor in the dish was bacon. I like bacon as much as the next person, but the flavor was overpowering. I gave half of it to my bacon-loving dining partner so that I could attempt to taste the other flavors. I was unsuccessful, as there were no other flavors to be found.

When I ordered, I was envisioning a luscious, rich, and creamy dish with a variety of subtle flavors and lots of cheesy goodness.  What I got was a boring plate of plain dry pasta with too much bacon crumbled on top. It was not good, and I would have been more satisfied eating Kraft from a box. 

 I was a fan of Brocach's downtown location so I was surprised by how much of a let-down this was. I also hear they have a site in Milwaukee now too. I fear that Brocach may be sacrificing quality for quantity in their recent expansions, and sadly, I cannot recommend this restaurant anymore based on the quality and flavor of the foods we tried. Step it up, Brocach!

Full disclosure: I don't think much of UK cuisine. It's always struck me as bland and obvious, both in conception and execution.

Maybe that admitted bias is why I ordered the Reuben Breakfast Burrito for my first visit to Brocach. The contents itself were done fairly even if the corned beef was (deliberately?) over seasoned. The eggs could have used some pop and suffered from the same overcooked problems most scrambled dishes do. I also wouldn't have minded some more kraut. The burrito's dough was tremendous however, light and flaky yet miraculously able to contain its contents. The potatoes on the side were also well cooked and not overly salty.

The service was excellent, I might add.

Hosted a bachelorette party of 15 here this past weekend.  Organizing with the Manager, Marcos, was a breeze.  He was so friendly and accommodating - he even made up a special menu that stated the name of the group and event.  It's amazing that we could reserve a group space for free.  The bride is not a real picky person, but commented on how great everything was.  Although she ordered the Reuben, she wished she would have ordered the Mac N' Cheese.  Drinks were great and server was attentive.  Definitely recommend for any group looking for a great atmosphere at very reasonable prices.

You know, I came in totally telling myself to order the Guinness braised beef and rate that because at this point the bangers and mash must just be so overrated and it could never live up to my expectations if greatness. So I sat down, got ready to order my braised beef with mash, but when the very nice waiter came and asked what I wanted, my mouth, by some will if its own, said bangers and mash. And man. My mouth is one smart cookie. I've been to Ireland twice but THIS. THIS stuff is good.

Now I'm not going to lie to you. It's 13$ for three sausages and mash. But yum. And filling enough, for a normal person at least, I've been told I eat like a baby dinosaur. 

Warning, get too much apple and sauce in one bite and it can get a little overwhelmingly sweet.
Also, it's a little dark for lunch.

We have been to Brocach on a few occasions in both locations. The staff are good and attentive. They can cater for celiac and have a list that can help you decide. I always like the full Irish breakfast. My wife got a biscuit with egg, cheese and rasher with a side of breakfast potatoes and fresh fruit. They changed our order because it had a sauce we did not request, so a whole new portion of potatoes and fruit. I think it is priced fairly well.
The food was flavorful service was awesome corn beef was a little chewy but still tasted really good

I had to spell this about 6 different ways before I found it - and I've been here probably 10 times.  Eep.

Anyway, onto the review.  We came here on New Year's Eve with a party of 8.  They shifted uncomfortably, said they would look around, then took us upstairs to a nearly empty bar.  Seriously, I know a party of 8 without reservations is a faux pas, but don't feign busy-ness just to make us feel bad about patronizing your business.

I started out with the potato leek soup which was very tasty.  Definitely recommend.  For dinner I had the Shepherd's Pie, which was delicious - though a leeeetle dry and a little too salty in the meat.  The meat was traditionally mixed with peas, with a big pile of mashed potatoes on top.  Somewhere in there either I needed a side of gravy (yes, I'm a fatass) or it needed more butter - but nonetheless, meat + mashed potatoes = mmmm.  I complemented my meat pie with a Stella, about which there is nothing to rave or complain.

Most of our table either had the regular Shep, veggie Shep, or fish and chips, and we all left satisfied.  The fish and chips looked awesome - crispy, thin batter, served with steak fries.  The veggie Shepherd's Pie was also reportedly good, with our veg friends saying it tasted just as good as meat... which I suppose is a compliment to fake meat, since I think it usually sucks.  Why you wouldn't just eat meat then, the world may never understand.

Our waiter was pretty good - he even kept separate checks for each patron, which was nice.  He kept messing up the names though, so I was like, "Either don't try to remember our names, or put the tickets in some sort of order, because we just have to correct you each time.  But really, thanks for splitting the checks...it's a big pet peeve of mine when you don't do that."

Anyway, despite the "we're so busy" shenanigans at the beginning, I was really happy with dinner.  It gave me a fabulous base for all that New Year's drinking, and it wasn't too pricey either.

Fairly generic food in a somewhat "Irish-themed" restaurant.
This is basically the place you come when you just want a decent drink halfway between where you are and your final destination to warm up or if every other place is full for dinner.

I really, really wanted to like this place, but unfortunately it did not meet my expectations. Boyfriend and I arrived at an off time and the place was almost empty (there were 2 other tables occupied). We waited about 10 minutes for drinks. Shepherd's pie was super disappointing and gave off a frozen vibe. Innards were watery and tasted like canned vegetable soup. Mashed potatoes were ice cold in many areas. Still on the hunt for a Shepard's pie that reminds me of time spent in Ireland. :(
Friendly staff. Good Irish brews and food. Had breakfast here with a friend. The sausage with the bangers and mash was excellent. I had the lox which was pretty great too

This was one of the first places I tried in Madison.  After having several brunches and lunches this is one of my favorite places to go.  The food at this clean, upscale Irish styled pub is consistently very good as is the atmosphere and service.

I came here because of my fellow Yelpers. It did not disappoint.

We had a scotch egg, and duck fat fries for appetizers. Both were delicious. The duck fat fries are probably one of the best things I've eaten in some time... AND, the left overs tasted great the next day!

My fianc√© had a salad, and she said she really liked it. I got the shepherd's pie, which was extremely delicious.

One thing I will say is this... the food came out SOOO fast. I mean, so fast that it almost felt like everything is pre-made in advance. It was literally 3-5 mins for the apps, and another 5 mins for the entrees. I've not seen that kind of speed before in a restaurant where everything is made fresh.

My new favorite place for Sunday brunch! Cozy atmosphere and dinning environment, and friendly waitresses, and especially they have very tasty food (my friend and I ordered The biscuits and gravy and Ploughman's breakfast, YUM!!!), all these are enough for you to walk in and enjoy. There were three musicians playing live classical music during our brunch time, wonderful experience at this place! PS. I love their decor and furniture, vintage and Irish style.

My son and I went to lunch here this week and it was a pleasant surprise.  We didn't know that they had only opened this restaurant/pub a couple a months ago, so we were impressed with the interior, service and food.  

My son ordered the Shepherd's Pie.  It was tasty with short ribs, potatoes, peas and carrots, but it wasn't in the form of a "pie".  It was almost deconstructed.   I ordered their macaroni and cheese.  It had a very rich cheese sauce and also kielbasa slices on top, but the real gift were the sauteed asparagus.  We had also ordered a "beer cheese dip" with large slices of soft pretzels.    

Our server, Sam, was so personable and pleasant.  He even conversed with me about his dreams, family, interests, and travel adventures.  My son and I had a most enjoyable afternoon.  If you're ever on Monroe St., check out this place.  You won't be disappointed.

Reuben classic sandwich was well executed.  the meat was nicely pulled, not just sliced as is the typical US method. Good balance of sauce and kraut. I have a hobby of trying Reubens in each country I visit, now up to about 20 cities in 16 countries in Europe and Asia. This sandwich ranks among the best!

Was a great 'true pub' we loved visiting as a family to have good food and a pint. Recent visit consisted of service so slow we went to the bar for a drink refill, 12 children running around screaming, and the football playoff games blaring so loud we couldn't hear ourselves speak. Labeled as Irish pub, our experience was a darker lit Buffalo Wild Wings. Won't be going back.

I love me some Irish bars something serious. Be it the beers, the atmosphere, the food. I love it all. 

This comes in quite handy having married an Irish woman that loves to take me to these types of places. 

We love this place so much, we decided to use their upstairs room for our wedding rehearsal dinner of roughly 25 people and couldn't have had a better time. The service was excellent and the view of the capital priceless (well I guess it did have a price, but well worth it). 

We even had an Irish band that plays there, Westwind, play the cocktail hour of our wedding.

College waitstaff that is better than most bar/restaurant places in the area I have found upon my 6+ visits. 

Great on a weeknight, weekend, or post Badger victory.

Stopped here for lunch with my young daughter before a shopping trip to Trader Joe's. I picked it because I figured it would have a kid's menu (it did). Really not a good experience with the service. While the food was really quite good (herbivore platter for me which had bread, pita chips, some kind of incredibly tasty hummus, carrots, olives) and macaroni and cheese for daughter (the BEST kid's macaroni and cheese I have sampled anywhere), our service left a lot to be desired.

Upon entering we were told to sit where we liked. We found a spot by the window and behind us sat two girls, probably in their mid-20's. Our server was VERY attentive to these girls, checking back on them at least 3x as well as conversing at length (I got the feeling maybe one of them had worked there with the server at one time by how they were chatting). This is fine EXCEPT he NEVER checked back with us, the only other people sitting in that area. He forgot to bring my daughter's milk and even though I tried to flag him down and even call after him, "excuse me sir"...nothing. Finally we sat for a good 10 minutes after finishing eating, with me constantly trying to catch his eye (he would literally walk right past us to talk to the girls directly behind us!) and he came over and said, "oh, I forgot the chocolate milk." I said, "we don't need it now but can she get her ice cream cup?" I was pretty annoyed at this point as I had been at what I had hoped would be a simple lunch for nearly an hour. This should NOT have taken so long! When he returns with the ice cream it's one of those pre-done kinds in a styrofoam cup. Daughter is insistent on eating it but it is ROCK HARD. More annoyance for me as I try to chisel her ice cream into edible bites. Maybe they could take the ice cream out when they see the customer is close to finished eating main course? It added another 10 minutes on to a lunch I had wanted to exit about 30 minutes before.

I won't return which is a shame because the food really was good. That's why it gets 3 stars...the food was probably close to 5...service a 2.

Graduation weekend, Sunday night.
We were trying to go to Graze which was closed. So my daughter called after 6pm for a 6:30 reservation. They don't take reservations more than an hour out. 
That's fine, but why didn't they tell us the place was dead and we didn't need a reservation. So my elderly mother waited another 45 minutes to walk into the place with only ONE other table seated. And only one other table seated after us.
And if they were that slow, why was our fish and chips really dark brown( shy of burnt) and dry? 
My mother didn't want to make a big deal since it was a dinner for my daughter's graduation, but we won't be returning. How hard is it to mess up Fish and Chips.
My daughter's Mac and Cheese was okay, tasted alright but watery.  I can't remember what my son-in-law order, so it wasn't outstanding.

I ate here for lunch with the family. Their kids menu is good, with actual dishes, not just heated up frozen food.  I had the Reuben. It was a bit huge, but very tasty.   The service was a little slow, and they were not crowded, so that's the reason for 4 stars. We ate outside. The tables out there are wobbly, making it a little difficult for the kids.

Was in Madison on business.  Went out and couldn't find what I was looking for for dinner, so I ended up here.  Atmosphere is OK.  It was nice, so the patio was full.  Inside was a little quite, but that's fine for a June Wednesday...

I sat at the bar and was approached quickly by the bartender.  Good beer.  Tried some local brews, and they aren't bad. 

Ordered the pan seared walleye for dinner.  It was delicious.  Perfectly cooked, lightly breaded, and yum- capers.  

The menu is full of delicious looking things, so I'll likely be back here next time I'm in town.

My wife and I have returned to Brocach's because of the fine ambience and customer service.  This time we sat outside with a glass of wine and took in the beautiful view of the capital and all the activity on the street.    Our waitstaff was friendly and helpful.  A bit slow but they were busy and we wern't in a hurry so really didn't matter.  Inside is pub like and cozy.

I would put Brocach's fish fry in my top 5 favorites in Madison. It wasn't too soggy and I like their tartar sauce, which had a lot of flavor. There's a generous portion of fries to go with the fish, and the coleslaw is not your average coleslaw. I had a Dublin mule to go with my meal and was not disappointed with the size or strength of the drink. 
My date for the night had the bangers and mash. While she hadn't had bangers and mash before, she left saying that because of Brocach's, she'll have high standards going forward!  She also appreciated that they served non-alcoholic beer. 
When we went on a Friday night, they had live Irish music which was a nice touch to our evening. We were far enough away from the band that we could still have a conversation. That, along with people watching in the window, made for an enjoyable date night indeed, and all for a very reasonable price!

Came here for a friend's bachelorette party a few weeks ago.  Love that they have small areas for groups to have their own space, so we were able to play some bachelorette games without disturbing other guests.  We were also able to bring in our own cake. 
Moscow mule here was well made and well worth the price.
I ordered the fish and chips and was super happy with my choice.  Fish was cooked right and the tartar sauce was fabulous.  Just wish I had more to go with the fish!  I asked for more, and by the time the waiter remembered I had asked, I was finished eating.
Because of the party, we had a limited menu, so I'd love to come back and be able to choose from the full menu.

Great beer cheese dip.  Irish Stew and corn beef and Cabbage were wonderful.  You know how some Irish-American restaurants "americanize" their Irish food?  That is not this place.  Very authentic flavor and presentation.

Some really really bad service. Not many people here, so it's not like the server was busy. Asked for a spicy Bloody Mary and was told 'why don't I bring the Tabasco and you can spice it yourself?' Then he brought the drink without Tabasco. Coffee was brought without any request for cream or sugar. Potatoes were excellent though.

In my crusade to find the best fish fry in Madison, my partner Jason O. referred me to the Brocach's Friday Fish Fry Special. For a mere $14, they serve an all-you-can-eat fried fish special. 

As soon as you walk into this restaurant (especially on a live music night) you feel like you've just walked into some Lord of the Rings tavern expecting Aragorn to eye you as you are seated. The atmosphere is very warm and very stereotypically Irish.

Although the service was a bit inattentive and slow, when the fish came out, it was fantastic. The batter was well seasoned on these generous planks of fish. The chips portion was good as you didn't get completely full on potatoes so that you could have more fish! The coleslaw was interestingly different as it was seasoned with some curry powder and included raisins mixed into the cabbage and mayonnaise mixture. I didn't really care for their tartar sauce as it seemed lacking in flavor, but that missing flavor was made up by the delicious fish. 

If you're hungry and have the appetite for a huge plate(s) of fish and chips, I would highly recommend this restaurant.

I'm amazed this this place doesn't have a higher rating on Yelp. 
I've been here a few times now, and it's been fantastic every time. Today I went in with my mom who is a really picky eater (sorry Mom!), so she usually asks for modifications to her order. She's not from Wisconsin, and she gets pretty excited about cheese curds when she comes out here (who doesn't, right?). When we went in today, we saw that their cheese curds are not on their brunch menu! We asked our server, and she said it wouldn't be a problem to make them for us. We had curds in less than 5 minutes!
I ordered the corned beef hash and it was absolutely delicious. I was a little afraid of the horseradish sauce, but it was perfect, and not over the top at all. I always get my eggs cooked over medium, but 90% of the time restaurants still only cook them over easy. Brocach actually cooked them over medium!
My mom ordered the French toast sans walnuts, and it was great. 
Both of our portions were huge, and we ended up with boxes to bring home. 
They have a great draft beer list, and I love the d√©cor/ambiance in here. Our service was perfect as well. There is not one thing that could have been better! The same is true of my previous visits. Even the food on the menu that I wouldn't order myself has been great (bangers and mash, shepherd's pie). I'm a big fan of this place.

While I still cannot pronounce this place- it doesn't matter as all you have to say is that you are going to the "Irish place" and everyone pronounces it for you. But if you are a trivia nut like me- Brocach is Irish for Badger Den- now how appropriate is that for a bar located in downtown Madison home of the Wisconsin Badgers??! 

On the night we were here -it was hot and humid. We opted to sit outside with an excellent view of the Capital but until the sun went down, it was pretty warm. The patio consists of 6 or so bistro tables but check inside with the host first if you plan to sit out there. Inside- there is a long, dark wood bar and plenty of tables between the two rooms. 

We ordered beer and a Meze platter which was basically two kinds of hummus, warm pita points, feta cheese and a small artichoke and tomato salad. Perfect for a hot night although hardly Irish. 

But if Irish food is what you want- they have it here. Shepard's pie, Fish and Chips, Bangors and Mash, Irish stew- all the favorites are on the menu. They also have a wide range of imported beers, and a good selection of unusual Irish and Scotch whiskeys. According to the bartender- they also have Irish music on select nights. 

So the next time you are little for a little "green" on the "Square"- check out Brocach. Best Badger Den I've ever set foot in!

Any place that offers happy hour every day is a winner in my book!

We stopped here to meet with some friends who were checking out a nearby store.  What a great little spot!  

We had some excellent service by our bartender, as well as the manager.  They were both friendly and took time to talk with us while we waited for our friends to arrive.  

I HIGHLY recommend the Bear Republic Scotch Ale if they have it available.  Man.  That one went down a little too quickly for me.  I couldn't keep my lips off of the glass.  SO good.

I really like their sangria, as well.  They make it to order, which is pretty awesome; so, you know it is fresh.  What stood out to me with theirs is that it was more on the dry side.  Some sangrias are too sweet.  This was not.  It definitely made it feel more refreshing while drinking it.

We ordered some appetizers, as well.  They were great!  Not to mention that they came out super fast, which is always helpful when you're borderline hangry, as we were.

The bathrooms were clean, but what I noticed, of course, were the red metallic painted walls in the ladies room.  Definitely photo worthy.

I will be recommending this place whenever my friends are looking for a place to get together!

Descriptive phrase: fun Irish bar.

Brocach on the Square gets points for the following:

1) putting up with our giant, rowdy (intoxicated) group
2) serving delicious cheese and sausage apps
3) having Lagavulin 16
4) understanding
Great comfort food at reasonable prices. Quality craft cocktails without pretense. Will revisit.
Had brunch here on Saturday. I decided to try the fried chicken Benedict. It was splendid.

I had lunch at Brochah yesterday--my first time since they remodeled.  It was Friday and I had fish and chips.  The fish and french fries were excellent!  I am giving it 4 stars because it's a little over-priced (my fish and chips were $14 but I got a lot of food and maybe that is a typical price for downtown Madison).  The menu is limited and hopefully they will expand it.

This place is UNBELIEVABLE. it's osteria papavero and gastropub in one!!!!!! Omg, if you've been to the branch at the Capitol, this is a totally different restaurant. They don't share a menu, and the food is WAYYYYYYYYY better. 

You can make reservations for big groups and by the table are HUGE sofa booths, very very nice to sit. Not so convenient for getting out if you're on the inside, but that's too bad for those who didn't realize the negative points in exchange for the good view :p

Food:
DUCK FAT FRIES. how can anyone not have this on the menu!!! oily little wedges.
Seafood risotto - soooooooooo good. best I ever had
Shepherd's pie - so huge you have to eat it for several meals (females and small appetites only)

Here, go ahead, go share my new favorite restaurant. Everyone leaves satisfied!

Ate lunch with my wife here.  The food menu is not very large (one sheet - front and back), but it has a lot of traditional items on it, and they offer a daily special if you feel like saving some cash.  The drink menu was quite a bit larger than the food menu (part of being a "pub" I suppose), but I was unable to sample off of it due to having to return to work.  Food was surprisingly very good for the simple dish that I ordered.

The environment definitely works - it's basically what I imagined in my mind's eye of what a traditional Irish pub would be, which I (sadly?) picture being like The Prancing Pony from the Lord of the Rings.  Large wooden booths, dimly lit, a little dingy, almost castle-like.  At first when you walk in it seems almost *too* dimly lit, like a dungeon, but eventually you adjust to it and it normalizes.

Will probably return sometime in the future to try some more traditional items off of the menu.
Nice beer selection. The ladies tending bar have always been friendly and cheerful. One guy who bartended was kind of a gruff sourpuss, but other than that the atmosphere here is great.

I'm a huge fan of this place.  The Irish food at this place is absolutely fantastic and definitely holds a candle to the food I've had in Dublin and Galway.  The atmosphere is top notch, and they have a decent selection of beers on tap (I think it was 12ish?).  

Price is more than other places in Madison, but it's not outrageous since food/drink seems to be cheaper in the area overall!  $12-15 for a main dish.

Amazingly delicious Irish food! The wait staff is incredibly helpful in making decisions. My partner loved the cottage pie and I had the fish and chips. Everything was very flavorful (more than other "Irish" bars for sure). Totally recommend this place.

Our original plan to have brunch at a different restaurant around the corner was met with a line out the door and a potential wait of 1.5 hours... so we decided on this place instead. The decor was quaint and exactly what you would expect from an Irish pub, and there were hardly any people in there at all! We were seated immediately at a big wooden table right next to a fireplace, which was the perfect thing for a sub-zero morning. Our server was kind and attentive even though he was very young - and he was knowledgeable about both the menu and the day's specials. I ordered the corned beef hash - IT WAS HEAVENLY. Real thick cuts of corned beef sauteed with onions, served on a bed of amazing roasted crispy potatoes. None of this dog food nonsense served from a can - oh, no. This was sumptuous, savory, and not overly salty either. Honestly the best corned beef hash that I've ever had! I will absolutely be coming back to try more of their menu.

Being from the UK, I find the concept of Irish themed Bars a little baffling, but really liked this one! They didn't only serve Irish beers, but had a nice little selection of local brews, which made it all the more unique.

It was a very dead night in Madison (we think all the students must have gone home), so we sat outside and enjoyed wonderful views off the capital building, which was all lit up and only steps away. 

All in all a pleasant evening with great drinks, decor and service!

As someone who studied abroad in Dublin, I love a good properly-poured Guinness. And that's one of the best reasons to go to Brocach! The ambiance is that of a classic Irish pub, the food is good. Brocach won't change your life, but you're sure not to be disappointed.

I am falling more in love with Monroe Street with every restaurant I try there. Brocach rocks. The ambiance is super cool and cozy, only complaint is I wish the place was bigger! We came in with a large party and had to wait about an hour. The bar area is a little small but the drinks made up for it. 

I tried the special Old Fashioned with ginger and it was delicious. We then tried a Scotch Egg for an appetizer which I thoroughly enjoyed. I had never heard of it before but can't wait to have another! For my meal, I had the apple brie sandwich with bacon with a side of greens. The sandwich was a little small for an entree, but the quality of the ingredients were top notch and the flavor was awesome. The salad was okay, but you got a lot of it to help fill you up from the small sammie. Overall, I'd order it again. 

Service was great, and our food came out fast. From what I've seen of the capitol location this place is much nicer. Can't wait to return to Monroe St. and Brocach!

Man, other people really love Brocach on Yelp, huh? It's fine, if you invite me there I will totally go with you (so, not 8 Seasons Grille. I will not go there, no no no, you can't make me), but it's not as good as other places in the same price range in Madison, so why? Why are we going to Brocach? I've been there a bunch, to both locations, but I can't remember what I ate, what I drank or the servers. Because they were meh. I guess you want meh sometimes, so in those time, this could be a good choice.

Went here last night after a recommendation from a friend. Had a large group of 11 and they were very helpful with assisting us sitting altogether. The waitress, Kelly, was great. Very attentive, friendly, and split up our check individually without hesitation or any kinda of disgust (like I see at many other restaurants when asking to split up a large check). 
The appetizer came very quickly and was delicious! All the food was terrific as well and affordable prices as well. Great atmosphere, comfortable chairs, and less crazy busy than the one downtown. We will definitely be back here again in the very near future.

I have tried many of the items over time.  I don't have a favorite, but my favorites are the fish fry, bangers and mashed, and pork loin.  I know this is a pub, but the ambience is actually upscale without being hoity toity.  It is comfortable and casual.  Far beyond the location and the ambience is the food.  That is what keeps me coming back.  This is definitely my St Patties day destination (unless I'm in Boston).  Which says a lot.  The pork loin is not what I expected at a pub.  It is sophisticated and perfectly seasoned.  I have had it several times and it is always perfectly cooked.  The fish has an amazingly well seasoned crispy breading and a flaky tasty fish.  I like the fries too, one of my favorites.  The bangers are an awesome sausage.  The mash are somehow very good.  I don't know what they put in them, but they are a bit better than the rest.
We haven't been here in awhile but it's nice to know they decided to be a real Irish pub. Great live music tonight. The fish fry was good, the Guinness stew was good, the service was great.

We went to Brocach because a local girls' group was having a fundraiser there and they were giving 10% of their profits to a girls' group in Tanzania. We are eating paleo these days but I was happy to find shepherds pie on the menu and my husband had corned beef and cabbage with mashed potatoes. Our only complaint was there wasn't much cabbage in his dish. Our son had mac-n-cheese and we were pleasantly surprised that it was a small serving with equal sized sides, peas and corn and green apples. It was quite kid-friendly, noisy enough that I didn't think worry about our kids bothering anyone but not so loud that we had trouble hearing each other.

Wooohooo absolute incredible Irish pub!!! The bangers and mash are a must!!!! I love the whole vibe of the place. Order a Guinness (or 3) and some whiskey. I can't believe I haven't tried this place yet. Again the food alone will have you coming back

Great atmosphere. Great food. Great price. If you're looking for a delicious and interesting place to eat around madison i would definitely recommend this place! I had the bangers and mash and it was very tasty. Mashed potatoes all day erry day
Therese was great. The drinks were great. The food was great. Yes all around. We'd be regulars if we lived in Madison.
Therese was great. The drinks were great. The food was great. Yes all around. We'd be regulars if we lived in Madison.

Food was just overcooked and sat in the window for too long. The Irish coffee is usually good, but sucked when they were busy. They took the stuff we didn't eat and drink off the bill. Everyone was awkward and didn't know how to handle us. And we got walked past empty tables and sat at some tiny table next to the kitchen
Amazing pub food. We got one of everything shareable for the table. The plow mans lunch was amazing as was the meat and cheese board.

The last time I went here I was served sweet potato fries that gave me and five of my friends horrible diarrhea. Instant one star for lack of proper food safety.

They were delicious though.

I had a Dublin burger, and a Steela beer. Food and drink  was Ok. The enviornment is great!  The people, the decor and my waitress are friendly. Just feel comfortable to be there. Certainly a place to drink again!! hahaha..

I've been to Brocach for the past few weekends and keep wanting to come back!  It's got a great vibe and is full of a variety of people- from the suits enjoying the end of their workweek to older students in jerseys and jeans.

Last night, I ordered a drink and didn't realize it came with a cherry (which I'm allergic to).  I mentioned something to the waiter and he immediately went back to the kitchen to check the cherry type, then remade my drink and brought it right back.  The entire time, he was super nice and even apologized for not mentioning that it came with a cherry, even though I should've been the one who asked him!  He served us with a smile and was very accommodating, even though the place was pretty crowded.

I definitely recommend it as a great place to relax and be around a bunch of welcoming people, customers and staff alike.

We stopped in for lunch mid-week in mid-December. I don't know much about Irish food, but thought it might be fun to try a couple of Irish brews. The decor was interesting. Plush seats on one side of a table and wooden chairs on the other side. Or wooden benches on one side of a table and plush chairs on the other. Everything seemed a little dark and heavy with lots of reds.

Our waitress was attentive and quick. I ordered a couple of beers from the beer list, unfortunately they were out of both of them. Our waitress recommended a substitution. It was fine, but not Irish.

For lunch I tried the poutine. It came with thick cut fries, cheese curds, and Shepherd's Pie filling. The fries were as-described - very thick cut. There were a lot of them and definitely tasted of potato. They really could have used more salt, pepper, or the Shepherd's Pie filling to give them some flavor. The cheese curds were a little jarring. I expected them to be warm and molten but they were cold bites surrounded by lots of potatoes. The Shepherd's Pie filling was delicious. Chunks of tasty root vegetables and a thick warm sauce. I really wish there had been more of this to truly cover all of those thick-cut fries.

I'm not going to rush back, but I'd give it another try and definitely order something different, maybe the regular Shepard's Pie?

Their burgers... yuuuuuum! You honestly can't go wrong with any of their burgers. 

On top of that, they make a mean Shepard's Pie, do a great Fish N' Chips and serve some delicious soups. 

Oh, and not to mention, they have a pretty extensive drinks list. 

I get it, Madison, you have some amazing pub food. Now if only there were more Chinese options...

I went here with some friends on a Monday evening and we all really enjoyed the food. Everyone started with the potato leek soup. It had a nice, light flavor and while it didn't necessarily stand out for me, it made for a nice start to my meal. I also sipped on a Manhattan and a Cha Cha Cha while I waited for my entree, the bangers and mash. I had to order it after reading all the positive reviews on Yelp and I was very pleased! Each component of the dish tasted well on its own and came together for a very flavorful, well balanced meal. Everyone else was happy with their orders, which were the Irish stew and fish and chips. The service there was pretty spot on, but it wasn't too busy either considering the day. Either way, I will be back again for sure!

The chef's banger and mash was certainly not worth $17. The mash potato was cold, the cilantro as garnish looked like it was days old. The sausage certainly was not extraordinary!!! Our waitress served us one time and never asked us if we needed refills. A lunch for 3 costs us $42. Most definitely not worth our money. One of us had the cod sandwich special which was okay. The best I guess was their grilled cheese sandwich and that as well wasn't the best. All in all, not going there again!!!!
Got ripped off majorly here. Unprofessional service and indifferent staff. Disappointed because of nice ambience.

Early Saturday evening service and it's not all too busy upstairs. Waitress was unsure of beers and never did bring that water we requested. The salmon came raw in the center. Too bad she forgot to tell us it came that way unless requested all the way done.  Sent it back to finish cooking it. Annoying wait....Tried to order donuts for dessert but they were out. It's 6pm and they're out of dessert?  Not.coming.back.
Shame when a pub uses cheater pints.  Cheater pints being the industry term for 14oz glasses, and advertising pints.  OTOH, service was prompt, food was great.  Braised beef, house IPA.

One of my favorite bars/restaurants in Madison for sure.  The food is not light,  which is to be expected of Irish fair, so leave the light attitude at home.  Happily large portions with reasonable prices!

The beer cheese over grilled bread was fantastic,  so long as they grill it to be crispy.  I have encountered soggy grilled bread on one occasion,  but still tasty, so I forgive them!

I loved the pairing of corned beef with the horseradish cream sauce which added a really velvety texture and tied the entire plate of meat and veggies together.  The bangers and mash are the best I have ever had, granted I'm a wisconsinite not of Irish heritage.  My favorite dish at Brocach is the fish and chips.  Eight ounces of fresh Atlantic cod in a beer batter with tarter sauce sure makes me happy.  The fish was flaky, moist and perfectly fried.   Although I can see why not everyone enjoys their chips/fries, I'm a fan.  They are sliced and quartered potatoes that are fried pretty dark, so there is a great crisp to them.  You will leave happy, content and full!

Great beer and booze selection!  If you're looking for a nice refreshing cocktail, I personally enjoy French 75's, and Brocach makes a great one!

I am a total fan of this place and will always come back when I have the chance.

I hope we hit Brocach on an off night. On a Wednesday during happy hour we tried the slider flight and were surprised that all 4 sliders were awful--some were overcooked, some had flavorless or slightly rancid ingredients, and all of them were poorly seasoned. The parmesan garlic fries were served in what even grease lovers like us had to agree was just too much grease, though the fries themselves had great texture and--when you got the too-strong garlic off--good flavor. The potato leek soup was thin, without any of the richness or flavor I would have expected.

Great place for dinner and atmosphere.  I was doubtful of the possibility of eating healthy in an Irish pub (or in the midwest, for that matter) but they actually had a good selection of creative, fresh salads, in addition to yummy looking meaty pub fare.  It felt immediately authentic as the host who seated us talked with an Irish brogue.  The large stuffed chairs and decorations on the walls made it feel as if we were in someones home (or castle.)  Great place for an out-of-towner to stop!
